sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security appoints banking veteran to board, updates governance By Investing.com
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (NASDAQ:HUBC) has appointed Vineet Malhotra, a banking veteran from Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC), to its Board of Directors as part of governance updates. The appointment comes as the company faces significant financial challenges, including a substantial debt burden and weak gross profit margins. HUB is also seeking shareholder approval for a potential reverse share split to maintain Nasdaq listing compliance, while simultaneously expanding services and resolving a U.S. securities class action lawsuit.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security appoints banking veteran to board, updates governance
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (NASDAQ:HUBC) appointed Vineet Malhotra, a banking veteran from CIBC, to its Board of Directors amidst financial challenges. The micro-cap cybersecurity firm, valued at $9.9 million, is strengthening its governance and capital framework and is seeking shareholder approval for a potential reverse share split. These changes aim to support its long-term strategy in confidential computing and cybersecurity.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. Appoints Vineet Malhotra to Board of Directors, Updates Governance and Capital Framework
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. has appointed Vineet Malhotra to its Board of Directors, significantly enhancing its governance structure with a focus on regulated financial infrastructure and risk management. This move supports HUB's long-term strategy and includes measures for shareholder protection, such as potentially implementing a reverse share split if needed to maintain Nasdaq compliance. CEO Noah Hershcoviz emphasized that strengthening governance is critical for disciplined execution and creating lasting shareholder value.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security CEO and board members begin open market share purchases
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (NASDAQ:HUBC) CEO Noah Hershcoviz and several board members have started purchasing company shares on the open market, driven by a belief in the company's long-term strategy despite the stock being oversold. These purchases occur as HUBC shares trade at $0.38, reflecting renewed insider confidence. This follows recent positive news including significant revenue for H1 2025, an improved gross margin, and strategic contracts.

feed.title: Why HUB Cyber Security's CEO and directors are buying their own stock
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security announced that its CEO, Noah Hershcoviz, and board members have commenced open-market purchases of the company's ordinary shares. This move signals high conviction in the company’s long-term strategy and internal alignment, despite recent stock declines following positive operational news. The announcement emphasizes that purchases comply with U.S. securities laws and may be ceased at the insiders' discretion.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Announces Open-Market Share Purchases By Insiders
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced that its CEO, Noah Hershcoviz, and several Board members are making open-market purchases of the company's ordinary shares. These purchases signify a strong personal investment and internal alignment with the company's strategic direction and future plans. All transactions comply with U.S. securities laws and are made at prevailing market prices.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. Executives Commence Open-Market Purchases of Company Shares
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced that its CEO, Noah Hershcoviz, and Board members are initiating open-market purchases of company shares, signaling strong confidence in HUB's long-term strategy. These personal investment decisions comply with U.S. securities laws and underscore internal alignment with the company's strategic direction. HUB specializes in confidential computing and cybersecurity solutions, partnering with major global institutions.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Announces Open-Market Share Purchases By Insiders
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (Nasdaq: HUBC) announced that its CEO, Noah Hershcoviz, and certain board members are initiating open-market purchases of the company's ordinary shares. These purchases signify a strong personal investment conviction in the company's long-term strategy and internal alignment with its strategic direction. All transactions comply with U.S. securities laws and are being conducted at prevailing market prices.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (Nasdaq: HUBC) Announces First Half 2025 Results and Declares Its Strategic Mission: Build the Global Trust Infrastructure for the Digital Economy
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (Nasdaq: HUBC) announced selected financial results for the first half of 2025, showing revenue of $15.1 million and a significant increase in gross margin to 23%. The company also outlined its strategic mission to become the global trust infrastructure for identity, secure data, and regulated AI, highlighting strengthened liquidity and decreased legacy obligations. CEO Noah Hershcoviz emphasized the company's rebuilt foundation and structural improvements, positioning HUB for greater discipline, scale, and financial resiliency in the digital economy.

feed.title: Cyber firm more than doubles margins to build a new trust layer online
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (Nasdaq: HUBC) announced its H1 2025 results, reporting $15.1 million in revenue and a significantly improved gross margin of 23%, up from 10% year-ago. The company also declared its strategic mission to become the global trust infrastructure for identity, secure data, and regulated AI. Despite operational progress and balance sheet strengthening, including the resolution of legacy obligations and enhanced liquidity, the stock saw a negative market reaction.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security reports $15.1 million revenue for first half of 2025
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. reported $15.1 million in revenue and a significant gross margin improvement to 23% for the first half of 2025. Despite this, the company faces a substantial debt burden and low current ratio, though it has restructured over 75% of historical debt and enhanced liquidity. The company also announced resolutions to historical disputes and expanded its services and intellectual property portfolio.

feed.title: Hub Cyber Security shareholders approve AGM proposals, special meeting set
feed.summary: Hub Cyber Security Ltd. (NASDAQ:HUBC) announced that its shareholders approved all proposals at the 2025 Annual General Meeting. The company also disclosed that a Special General Meeting of Shareholders is scheduled for December 30, 2025, with details provided in a recent SEC filing.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Announces Special Meeting for Reverse Share Split
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. held its Annual General Meeting on December 16, 2025, where all proposals were approved. The company also announced a Special General Meeting for December 30, 2025, to discuss a reverse share split of its ordinary shares. This action is intended to optimize HUB Cyber Security's market positioning; however, TipRanks' AI Analyst "Spark" rates HUBC as Underperform due to poor financial performance and a bearish technical outlook.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Announces Deepening of Engagement With Leading European Financial Institution
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced an expanded engagement with a major European financial institution, adding new cybersecurity assessment and consultancy services. This expansion includes application security testing, mobile-application penetration testing, and code-review services, demonstrating the client's confidence in HUB's capabilities and supporting the company's European growth strategy in the financial sector.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Announces Deepening of Engagement With Leading European Financial Institution
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (Nasdaq: HUBC) announced an expanded relationship with a major European financial institution, adding new cybersecurity assessment and consultancy services to an existing multi-year engagement. The expanded scope includes application security testing, mobile-application penetration testing, and code-review services. This move aligns with HUB's European growth strategy, demonstrating continued client confidence in their performance.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (Nasdaq: HUBC) adds app security testing for major European bank
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (Nasdaq: HUBC) has expanded its engagement with a major European financial institution, adding cybersecurity assessment and consultancy services, including mobile-application penetration testing and code-review services. This move aligns with HUB's strategy to bolster its presence in Europe by offering security, compliance, and secured data fabric solutions to regulated financial institutions. CEO Noah Hershcoviz emphasized that the deepened relationship highlights the client's confidence in HUB's performance and is a key step in its ongoing European market expansion.

feed.title: Hub Cyber Security Successfully Settles Legacy Class Action Litigation and Removes Structural Friction to Accelerate Execution
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (Nasdaq: HUBC) announced the successful settlement of a U.S. securities class action related to its 2023 IPO for $11 million, primarily financed by insurance carriers. This resolution removes significant litigation friction, allowing the company to focus on its core business of confidential computing and secured data fabric technologies. HUB anticipates filing its interim financials and providing a formal business update that will reflect stronger performance and strategic alignment.

feed.title: Hub Cyber Security stock tumbles after $11 million settlement
feed.summary: Hub Cyber Security Ltd. stock plunged 27.3% after announcing an $11 million settlement for a U.S. securities class action lawsuit related to its 2023 IPO. The settlement, which is financed primarily by insurance carriers, aims to close a "legacy litigation chapter" and remove a "structural barrier" to operations. The company plans to release interim financial statements and a formal business update, reflecting higher gross margins.

feed.title: Hub Cyber Security Settles Legacy U.S. Securities Class Action Related To Its 2023 IPO
feed.summary: Hub Cyber Security Ltd (HUBC) has successfully settled a legacy U.S. securities class action related to its 2023 IPO for a total consideration of $11 million. This settlement, pending final court approval, is intended to close the litigation chapter for the company.

feed.title: Key facts: HUB Cyber Security develops finance platform; settles IPO lawsuit
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (HUBC) is transitioning from a cybersecurity focus to becoming a core provider for automated financial operations, developing a platform for financial institutions. The company also settled a U.S. securities class action lawsuit related to its 2023 IPO for $11 million, pending final court approval.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. Announces $11 Million Settlement to Resolve U.S. Securities Class Action Related to 2023 IPO
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced an $11 million settlement to resolve a U.S. securities class action related to its 2023 IPO, pending final court approval. The settlement, largely financed by the company's insurance carriers, aims to remove legal distractions and allow HUB to focus on business growth. CEO Noah Hershcoviz stated this settlement marks a strategic reset, enabling the company to enhance its mission of securing sensitive digital assets and prepare a business update reflecting improved financials.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) details platform for machine-driven finance compliance
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) is developing an operational platform for automated, compliance-driven finance, focusing on authentication, credentialing, audit trails, and high-volume transaction oversight. Despite securing commercial contracts for KYC and AML operations and positioning itself for growth in fintech and digital assets, the company's stock has experienced negative market reactions even to positive news. The article suggests the market undervalues HUBC due to a small public float and a perception that hasn't caught up with the company's strategic shift from traditional cybersecurity to essential autonomous financial oversight.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security's Published Architecture Points to a Much Larger Opportunity
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ: HUBC) is described as a company that is quietly building an essential platform to support the shift towards automated, compliance-driven finance, despite its current low stock valuation. The article posits that HUB is moving beyond traditional cybersecurity to become a core systems provider for automated financial operations, offering solutions for authentication, credentialing, audit trails, and high-volume transaction oversight. This strategic shift and the mandatory nature of its security architecture present a significant, unpriced value proposition for investors as autonomous finance becomes increasingly prevalent.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) lands multi-year defense software deal in aerospace
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) has launched HUB Compliance™, a hardware-rooted trust engine combining confidential computing, automated policy enforcement, and verifiable logging for audit-ready compliance in regulated sectors. The company secured a multi-year perpetual-license and support deal with a major aerospace and defense manufacturer, positioning HUB Compliance™ as critical infrastructure for banks, insurers, fintechs, digital-asset platforms, and government agencies. This defense validation signifies the platform's deployment in high-security environments, attracting attention from financial institutions and regulators seeking robust data security and auditability.

feed.title: AI Attacks Surge 156% as Enterprises Rush to Lock Down Quantum-Vulnerable Systems
feed.summary: Cybersecurity threats escalated significantly in late 2025, with AI-weaponized attacks increasing by 156% and global cybercrime losses projected to reach $10.5 trillion. In response, companies like QSE - Quantum Secure Encryption Corp., Broadcom Inc., Zscaler, Inc., Okta, Inc., and HUB Cyber Security Ltd. are advancing solutions such as quantum-resilient encryption, Zero Trust architectures, and unified identity management to combat these sophisticated threats and prepare for the post-quantum era. Many businesses, however, still lack formal roadmaps for migrating to quantum-safe algorithms.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ: HUBC) rolls out HUB Compliance to speed institutional oversight
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) announced that its HUB Compliance™ framework, leveraging confidential computing and automated evidence generation, transforms regulatory pressure into operational efficiency for institutions. The company highlights a recent commercial win with a defense-aligned buyer as validation of its approach, aiming to accelerate institutional adoption and make compliance a strategic differentiator. HUB Compliance™ seeks to embed proof and auditability directly into financial workflows, reducing friction in onboarding and settlement processes.

feed.title: The Global Infrastructure of Trust Is Being Rebuilt, and HUB Cyber Security Is Becoming One of Its Architects
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) is redefining cybersecurity by focusing on the hardware layer and foundational digital trust, rather than just software updates and breach containment. The company's confidential computing engine and HUB Compliance™ framework provide a structural answer to the challenge of verifiable data in an increasingly complex digital economy. A new commercial contract, particularly with a defense-grade buyer, validates HUB's technology as deployable and reliable, marking a significant shift from concept to proven application in environments demanding accuracy and integrity.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Turns Regulatory Pressure Into Institutional Speed
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) is reframing compliance from a cost to a performance feature through its HUB Compliance™ framework, leveraging confidential computing and automated evidence generation. This approach allows institutions to prove their behavior at the hardware layer, leading to faster onboarding and verification while providing clear, mathematical evidence for regulators. The company's recent commercial win, particularly with a defense-aligned buyer, validates its technology and is expected to accelerate adoption in institutional finance.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) rolls out HUB Compliance after commercial win
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ:HUBC) has commercially rolled out its HUB Compliance™ platform, which utilizes confidential computing, AI-driven automation, and a secured data fabric to streamline audit-ready compliance for the regulated financial sector. This launch, coupled with a major commercial win, signifies HUB's transition from a niche cybersecurity vendor to an infrastructure provider for regulated finance. The company aims to address the increasing regulatory demands on banks, asset managers, fintechs, and digital-asset firms globally.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ: HUBC) wins defense deal as HUB Compliance goes global
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (NASDAQ: HUBC) has launched HUB Compliance, a secure data fabric powered by confidential computing, and secured a defense-grade contract in December 2025. This contract validates the survivability of their technology in zero-tolerance environments and supports a global rollout with deployments across European institutions. The company also underwent a significant financial restructuring and advanced its HUB Token roadmap, positioning itself as a leader in verifiable digital trust and secure financial infrastructure.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Announces Major Commercial Win Following New Agreement With Leading Aerospace & Defense Manufacturer
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced a significant multi-year commercial licensing software agreement with a major aerospace and defense manufacturer for its FavoWeb FRACAS reliability-intelligence platform. This deal strengthens HUB's position in mission-critical environments, with anticipated six-figure revenues and growth potential as FavoWeb supports a critical aerospace development program. The agreement highlights the trust in HUB's technology after an extensive technical evaluation.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security signs software deal with major aerospace manufacturer
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (NASDAQ:HUBC) has secured a multi-year commercial licensing agreement for its FavoWeb FRACAS reliability-intelligence platform with a major aerospace and defense manufacturer. This deal, expected to generate a six-figure revenue, comes as the micro-cap company faces financial challenges but is actively pursuing growth through technological expansion and financial restructuring. HUB Cyber Security specializes in confidential computing and AI-driven cybersecurity solutions for regulated industries.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security completes debt restructuring to support growth
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced it has completed a financial restructuring of its outstanding debt, aiming for "infrastructure-scale growth." The company has reduced its $40.17 million debt burden by repaying legacy obligations and converting secured debt into unsecured convertible notes. This strategic move is expected to enhance financial flexibility and support the scaling of its confidential computing and secured data fabric technologies.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Completes Financial Overhaul, Restructuring More Than 75% of Legacy Obligations and Enabling Long-Cycle Execution
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security announced the completion of a financial restructuring, having repaid legacy obligations and retired a majority of previously disclosed debts. This overhaul aims to remove operational constraints, strengthen its capital structure for durability, and enable long-term execution for the company's confidential computing and cybersecurity platforms. HUB plans to file its interim financial results and announce an earnings call date next week.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. Unveils Trvsthub™ Platform and HUB Token to Enhance Self-Sovereign Identity in Digital Finance
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. has announced the Trvsthub™ platform and HUB Token (HUBT) to establish self-sovereign identity (SSI) for a secure financial ecosystem. The platform aims to enhance efficiency, compliance, and trust in stablecoin transactions, cryptocurrency payments, and cross-border remittances by integrating SSI to reduce redundancies and facilitate instant identity verification. HUBT is designed to offer ultra-low transaction fees and improve market efficiency, addressing cybercrime's economic impact.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Unveils HUB Token; Q1 2026 Launch, $1.2T Target
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security (Nasdaq: HUBC) announced its plan to launch the HUB Token (HUBT) and the Trvsthub™ platform in Q1 2026. This initiative aims to integrate AI-native Secured Data Fabric with blockchain and self-sovereign identity to enable frictionless transactions and target markets worth over $1.2 trillion, including digital identity, stablecoins, crypto payments, and remittances. The company projects significant cost reductions for KYC/AML processes and faster onboarding times through its SSI-driven approach.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. Launches HUB Compliance™ for Global Financial Institutions to Enhance Regulatory Oversight and Efficiency
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. has globally launched HUB Compliance™, a next-generation platform for financial institutions, built on its proprietary Secured Data Fabric technology. The platform unifies confidential computing, AI, and automation to streamline compliance processes like AML/KYC, currently deployed by major European banks and now expanding to North America, Asia, and the Middle East. HUB aims to transform compliance from a cost center into a competitive advantage, emphasizing AI-driven detection, automation, and robust auditability.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Completes Acquisition of BlackSwan
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. announced the completion of its acquisition of BlackSwan Technologies, a move expected to solidify HUB's position in secured data fabric solutions and AI-powered data solutions. This strategic acquisition aims to capitalize on a projected $12.91 billion market by 2032, particularly serving banks, fintechs, and governments with advanced security and compliance technologies. HUB anticipates significant revenue growth and additional bookings of over $25 million in 2025 from the combined operations.

feed.title: HUB Cyber Security Acquires BlackSwan Technologies,
feed.summary: HUB Cyber Security Ltd. (NASDAQ: HUBC) announced its acquisition of BlackSwan Technologies, Inc., a move that positions HUB as a dominant player in secured data fabric solutions for financial institutions. The acquisition integrates BlackSwan's AI-powered data fabric technology and existing contracts with major banks into HUB's portfolio, aiming to offer unparalleled solutions for data protection, compliance, and guarding against financial crime. This stock-for-stock transaction values the combined entity's market opportunity at over $500 million and is expected to enhance HUB's leadership in secured data management and compliance.

feed.title: Hub Cyber Security Powers Up: Major Debt Reduction, Fresh Investment, Board Change & More
feed.summary: Hub Cyber Security (NASDAQ: HUBC) is undertaking significant financial restructuring, including a 70% reduction in $5.7 million convertible note obligations and securing an additional $1 million investment. The company is also refinancing another $7.5 million in debt and has appointed Renah Persofsky to its Board of Directors to strengthen its financial foundation and leadership. These moves are aimed at bolstering its balance sheet and driving innovation in cybersecurity.

feed.title: HUB Security Announces that its Chief Financial Officer Has Stepped Down and Commences Search for Permanent CFO
feed.summary: HUB Security announced that its Chief Financial Officer, Hugo Goldman, has stepped down from his position, effective immediately, to pursue other interests. Mr. Goldman will remain with the company in an advisory capacity until September 30, 2023, to ensure a smooth transition. The company has initiated a global search for a new CFO, with Lior Davidson, VP of Finance, serving as Interim CFO.

feed.title: Latham Advises HUB on de-SPAC Business Combination With Mount Rainier Acquisition Corp.
feed.summary: Latham & Watkins advised HUB Cyber Security Ltd. on the completion of its business combination with Mount Rainier Acquisition Corp., resulting in the combined company operating as Hub Cyber Security Ltd. and trading on Nasdaq under the ticker “HUBC” as of March 1, 2023. This move followed HUB's delisting from the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange. A multidisciplinary Latham team led the deal, covering capital markets, M&A, tax, employment, data privacy, ESG, sanctions, and compliance matters.
